trans-unit.source: Use R in HDInsight to customize clusters | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use R in HDInsight to customize clusters | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to install and use R to customize Hadoop clusters.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to install and use R to customize Hadoop clusters.

trans-unit.source: Install and use R on HDInsight Hadoop clusters
trans-unit.target: Install and use R on HDInsight Hadoop clusters

trans-unit.source: You can install R on any type of cluster in Hadoop on HDInsight by using **Script Action** cluster customization.
trans-unit.target: You can install R on any type of cluster in Hadoop on HDInsight by using **Script Action** cluster customization.

trans-unit.source: This enables data scientists and analysts to use R to deploy the powerful MapReduce/YARN programming framework to process large amounts of data on Hadoop clusters that are deployed in HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: This enables data scientists and analysts to use R to deploy the powerful MapReduce/YARN programming framework to process large amounts of data on Hadoop clusters that are deployed in HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Script action lets you run scripts to customize a cluster, only when the cluster is being created.
trans-unit.target: Script action lets you run scripts to customize a cluster, only when the cluster is being created.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Customize HDInsight cluster using script action][hdinsight-cluster-customize].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Customize HDInsight cluster using script action][hdinsight-cluster-customize].

trans-unit.source: What is R?
trans-unit.target: What is R?

trans-unit.source: The R Project for Statistical Computing is an open source language and environment for statistical computing.
trans-unit.target: The R Project for Statistical Computing is an open source language and environment for statistical computing.

trans-unit.source: R provides hundreds of build-in statistical functions and its own programming language that combines aspects of functional and object-oriented programming.
trans-unit.target: R provides hundreds of build-in statistical functions and its own programming language that combines aspects of functional and object-oriented programming.

trans-unit.source: It also provides extensive graphical capabilities.
trans-unit.target: It also provides extensive graphical capabilities.

trans-unit.source: R is the preferred programming environment for most professional statisticians and scientists in a wide variety of fields.
trans-unit.target: R is the preferred programming environment for most professional statisticians and scientists in a wide variety of fields.

trans-unit.source: R scripts can be run on Hadoop clusters in HDInsight that were customized using Script Action when created to install the R environment.
trans-unit.target: R scripts can be run on Hadoop clusters in HDInsight that were customized using Script Action when created to install the R environment.

trans-unit.source: R is compatible with Azure Blob Storage (WASB) so that data that is stored there can be processed using R on HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: R is compatible with Azure Blob Storage (WASB) so that data that is stored there can be processed using R on HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Install R
trans-unit.target: Install R

trans-unit.source: A [sample script](https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/rconfigactionv02/r-installer-v02.ps1) to install R on an HDInsight cluster is available from a read-only blob in Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: A [sample script](https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/rconfigactionv02/r-installer-v02.ps1) to install R on an HDInsight cluster is available from a read-only blob in Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: This section provides instructions about how to use the sample script while provisioning the cluster using the Azure preview portal.
trans-unit.target: This section provides instructions about how to use the sample script while provisioning the cluster using the Azure preview portal.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The sample script was introduced with HDInsight cluster version 3.1.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The sample script was introduced with HDInsight cluster version 3.1.

trans-unit.source: For more information about HDInsight cluster versions, see [HDInsight cluster versions](../hdinsight-component-versioning/).
trans-unit.target: For more information about HDInsight cluster versions, see [HDInsight cluster versions](../hdinsight-component-versioning/).

trans-unit.source: When you provision an HDInsight cluster from the preview portal, click **Optional Configuration**, and then click **Script Actions**.
trans-unit.target: When you provision an HDInsight cluster from the preview portal, click **Optional Configuration**, and then click **Script Actions**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Script Actions** page, enter the following values:
trans-unit.target: On the **Script Actions** page, enter the following values:

trans-unit.source: Use Script Action to customize a cluster
trans-unit.target: Use Script Action to customize a cluster

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Specify a name for the script action, for example, Install R.
trans-unit.target: Specify a name for the script action, for example, Install R.

trans-unit.source: Script URI
trans-unit.target: Script URI

trans-unit.source: Specify the URI to the script that is invoked to customize the cluster, for example, https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/rconfigactionv02/r-installer-v02.ps1
trans-unit.target: Specify the URI to the script that is invoked to customize the cluster, for example, https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/rconfigactionv02/r-installer-v02.ps1

trans-unit.source: Node Type
trans-unit.target: Node Type

trans-unit.source: Specify the nodes on which the customization script is run.
trans-unit.target: Specify the nodes on which the customization script is run.

trans-unit.source: You can choose All Nodes, Head nodes only, or Worker nodes only.
trans-unit.target: You can choose All Nodes, Head nodes only, or Worker nodes only.

trans-unit.source: Parameters
trans-unit.target: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Specify the parameters, if required by the script.
trans-unit.target: Specify the parameters, if required by the script.

trans-unit.source: However, the script to install R does not require any parameters, so you can leave this blank.
trans-unit.target: However, the script to install R does not require any parameters, so you can leave this blank.

trans-unit.source: You can add more than one script action to install multiple components on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: You can add more than one script action to install multiple components on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: After you have added the scripts, click the check mark to start provisioning the cluster.
trans-unit.target: After you have added the scripts, click the check mark to start provisioning the cluster.

trans-unit.source: You can also use the script to install R on HDInsight by using Azure PowerShell or the HDInsight .NET SDK.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the script to install R on HDInsight by using Azure PowerShell or the HDInsight .NET SDK.

trans-unit.source: Instructions for these procedures are provided later in this article.
trans-unit.target: Instructions for these procedures are provided later in this article.

trans-unit.source: Run R scripts
trans-unit.target: Run R scripts

trans-unit.source: This section describes how to run an R script on the Hadoop cluster with HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: This section describes how to run an R script on the Hadoop cluster with HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: **Establish a Remote Desktop connection to the cluster**: From the preview portal, enable Remote Desktop for the cluster you created with R installed, and then connect to the cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Establish a Remote Desktop connection to the cluster**: From the preview portal, enable Remote Desktop for the cluster you created with R installed, and then connect to the cluster.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see Connect to HDInsight clusters using RDP.
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see Connect to HDInsight clusters using RDP.

trans-unit.source: **Open the R console**: The R installation puts a link to the R console on the desktop of the head node.
trans-unit.target: **Open the R console**: The R installation puts a link to the R console on the desktop of the head node.

trans-unit.source: Click on it to open the R console.
trans-unit.target: Click on it to open the R console.

trans-unit.source: **Run the R script**: The R script can be run directly from the R console by pasting it, selecting it, and pressing ENTER.
trans-unit.target: **Run the R script**: The R script can be run directly from the R console by pasting it, selecting it, and pressing ENTER.

trans-unit.source: Here is a simple example script that generates the numbers 1 to 100 and then multiplies them by 2.
trans-unit.target: Here is a simple example script that generates the numbers 1 to 100 and then multiplies them by 2.

trans-unit.source: The first two lines call the RHadoop libraries that are installed with R. The final line prints the results to the console.
trans-unit.target: The first two lines call the RHadoop libraries that are installed with R. The final line prints the results to the console.

trans-unit.source: The output should look like this:
trans-unit.target: The output should look like this:

trans-unit.source: Install R using Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Install R using Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: In this section, we use the **Add-AzureHDInsightScriptAction** cmdlet to invoke scripts by using Script Action to customize a cluster.
trans-unit.target: In this section, we use the **Add-AzureHDInsightScriptAction** cmdlet to invoke scripts by using Script Action to customize a cluster.

trans-unit.source: Before proceeding, make sure you have installed and configured Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Before proceeding, make sure you have installed and configured Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: For information about configuring a workstation to run HDInsight Powershell cmdlets, see [Install and configure Azure PowerShell][powershell-install-configure].
trans-unit.target: For information about configuring a workstation to run HDInsight Powershell cmdlets, see [Install and configure Azure PowerShell][powershell-install-configure].

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Open the Azure PowerShell console and declare the following variables:
trans-unit.target: Open the Azure PowerShell console and declare the following variables:

trans-unit.source: Specify the configuration values (such as nodes in the cluster) and the default storage to be used.
trans-unit.target: Specify the configuration values (such as nodes in the cluster) and the default storage to be used.

trans-unit.source: Use **Add-AzureHDInsightScriptAction** cmdlet to invoke the sample script to install R, for example:
trans-unit.target: Use **Add-AzureHDInsightScriptAction** cmdlet to invoke the sample script to install R, for example:

trans-unit.source: **Add-AzureHDInsightScriptAction** cmdlet takes the following parameters:
trans-unit.target: **Add-AzureHDInsightScriptAction** cmdlet takes the following parameters:

trans-unit.source: Parameter
trans-unit.target: Parameter

trans-unit.source: Definition
trans-unit.target: Definition

trans-unit.source: Config
trans-unit.target: Config

trans-unit.source: Configuration object to which script action information is added
trans-unit.target: Configuration object to which script action information is added

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Name of the script action
trans-unit.target: Name of the script action

trans-unit.source: ClusterRoleCollection
trans-unit.target: ClusterRoleCollection

trans-unit.source: Specifies the nodes on which the customization script is run.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the nodes on which the customization script is run.

trans-unit.source: The valid values are **HeadNode** (to install on the head node) or **DataNode** (to install on all the data nodes).
trans-unit.target: The valid values are **HeadNode** (to install on the head node) or **DataNode** (to install on all the data nodes).

trans-unit.source: You can use either or both values.
trans-unit.target: You can use either or both values.

trans-unit.source: Parameters
trans-unit.target: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Parameters required by the script
trans-unit.target: Parameters required by the script

trans-unit.source: Uri
trans-unit.target: Uri

trans-unit.source: Specifies the URI to the script that is executed
trans-unit.target: Specifies the URI to the script that is executed

trans-unit.source: Finally, provision the cluster that you customized to have R installed.
trans-unit.target: Finally, provision the cluster that you customized to have R installed.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, enter the credentials for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, enter the credentials for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: It can take several minutes before the cluster is created.
trans-unit.target: It can take several minutes before the cluster is created.

trans-unit.source: Install R using the .NET SDK
trans-unit.target: Install R using the .NET SDK

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight .NET SDK provides .NET client libraries that makes it easier to work with HDInsight from a .NET application.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight .NET SDK provides .NET client libraries that makes it easier to work with HDInsight from a .NET application.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following procedures to provision an HDInsight cluster using the SDK:
trans-unit.target: Perform the following procedures to provision an HDInsight cluster using the SDK:

trans-unit.source: Install the HDInsight .NET SDK
trans-unit.target: Install the HDInsight .NET SDK

trans-unit.source: Create a self-signed certificate
trans-unit.target: Create a self-signed certificate

trans-unit.source: Create a .NET application in Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Create a .NET application in Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Run the application
trans-unit.target: Run the application

trans-unit.source: The following sections show how to perform these procedures.
trans-unit.target: The following sections show how to perform these procedures.

trans-unit.source: To install the HDInsight .NET SDK
trans-unit.target: To install the HDInsight .NET SDK

trans-unit.source: You can install latest published build of the SDK from [NuGet](http://nuget.codeplex.com/wikipage?title=Getting%20Started).
trans-unit.target: You can install latest published build of the SDK from [NuGet](http://nuget.codeplex.com/wikipage?title=Getting%20Started).

trans-unit.source: The instructions will be shown in the next procedure.
trans-unit.target: The instructions will be shown in the next procedure.

trans-unit.source: To create a self-signed certificate
trans-unit.target: To create a self-signed certificate

trans-unit.source: Create a self-signed certificate, install it on your workstation, and upload it to your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: Create a self-signed certificate, install it on your workstation, and upload it to your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [Create a self-signed certificate](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=511138).
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [Create a self-signed certificate](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=511138).

trans-unit.source: To create a .NET application in Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: To create a .NET application in Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Open Visual Studio 2013.
trans-unit.target: Open Visual Studio 2013.

trans-unit.source: From the **File** menu, click **New**, and then click **Project**.
trans-unit.target: From the **File** menu, click **New**, and then click **Project**.

trans-unit.source: From **New Project**, type or select the following values:
trans-unit.target: From **New Project**, type or select the following values:

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: Category
trans-unit.target: Category

trans-unit.source: Templates/Visual C#/Windows
trans-unit.target: Templates/Visual C#/Windows

trans-unit.source: Template
trans-unit.target: Template

trans-unit.source: Console Application
trans-unit.target: Console Application

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: CreateRCluster
trans-unit.target: CreateRCluster

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to create the project.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to create the project.

trans-unit.source: From the **Tools** menu, click **Nuget Package Manager**, and then click **Package Manager Console**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Tools** menu, click **Nuget Package Manager**, and then click **Package Manager Console**.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command in the console to install the package.
trans-unit.target: Run the following command in the console to install the package.

trans-unit.source: This command adds the .NET libraries and references to them from the current Visual Studio project.
trans-unit.target: This command adds the .NET libraries and references to them from the current Visual Studio project.

trans-unit.source: From **Solution Explorer**, double-click **Program.cs** to open it.
trans-unit.target: From **Solution Explorer**, double-click **Program.cs** to open it.

trans-unit.source: Add the following **using** statements to the top of the file:
trans-unit.target: Add the following **using** statements to the top of the file:

trans-unit.source: In the **Main()** function, paste the following code, and provide values for the variables :
trans-unit.target: In the **Main()** function, paste the following code, and provide values for the variables :

trans-unit.source: Append the following code to the **Main()** function to use the [ScriptAction](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/microsoft.windowsazure.management.hdinsight.clusterprovisioning.data.scriptaction.aspx) class to invoke a custom script to install R.
trans-unit.target: Append the following code to the **Main()** function to use the [ScriptAction](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/microsoft.windowsazure.management.hdinsight.clusterprovisioning.data.scriptaction.aspx) class to invoke a custom script to install R.

trans-unit.source: Finally, create the cluster:
trans-unit.target: Finally, create the cluster:

trans-unit.source: Save changes to the application and build the solution.
trans-unit.target: Save changes to the application and build the solution.

trans-unit.source: To run the application
trans-unit.target: To run the application

trans-unit.source: Open the Azure PowerShell console, navigate to the location where you saved the project, navigate to the \bin\debug directory within the project, and then run the following command:
trans-unit.target: Open the Azure PowerShell console, navigate to the location where you saved the project, navigate to the \bin\debug directory within the project, and then run the following command:

trans-unit.source: Provide a cluster name and press ENTER to provision a cluster with R installed.
trans-unit.target: Provide a cluster name and press ENTER to provision a cluster with R installed.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.source: [Install and use Spark on HDInsight clusters][hdinsight-install-spark] for instructions about how to use cluster customization to install and use Spark on HDInsight Hadoop clusters.
trans-unit.target: [Install and use Spark on HDInsight clusters][hdinsight-install-spark] for instructions about how to use cluster customization to install and use Spark on HDInsight Hadoop clusters.

trans-unit.source: Spark is an open-source parallel processing framework that supports in-memory processing to boost the performance of big data analytic applications.
trans-unit.target: Spark is an open-source parallel processing framework that supports in-memory processing to boost the performance of big data analytic applications.

trans-unit.source: [Install Giraph on HDInsight clusters](../hdinsight-hadoop-giraph-install).
trans-unit.target: [Install Giraph on HDInsight clusters](../hdinsight-hadoop-giraph-install).

trans-unit.source: Use cluster customization to install Giraph on HDInsight Hadoop clusters.
trans-unit.target: Use cluster customization to install Giraph on HDInsight Hadoop clusters.

trans-unit.source: Giraph allows you to perform graph processing using Hadoop, and it can be used with Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Giraph allows you to perform graph processing using Hadoop, and it can be used with Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: [Install Solr on HDInsight clusters](../hdinsight-hadoop-solr-install).
trans-unit.target: [Install Solr on HDInsight clusters](../hdinsight-hadoop-solr-install).

trans-unit.source: Use cluster customization to install Solr on HDInsight Hadoop clusters.
trans-unit.target: Use cluster customization to install Solr on HDInsight Hadoop clusters.

trans-unit.source: Solr allows you to perform powerful search operations on stored data.
trans-unit.target: Solr allows you to perform powerful search operations on stored data.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
